evals.expected_output: A git commit is created with a Conventional Commit message, files are staged individually, formatters run on relevant files only, Co-Authored-By question is asked
expectations: The skill checks git status first and verifies the repo is not in merge/rebase state
The skill runs git diff and git diff --cached to understand changes
The skill checks which file types changed before running formatters
The skill only runs forge fmt if .sol files are among the changes
The skill only runs yarn lint/prettier if JS files under src/js/ changed
Files are staged individually with git add <file>, not git add -A or git add .
The skill skips .env files and warns the user if detected
The commit message follows Conventional Commits format: type(scope): description
The commit message description is imperative mood, lowercase, no period, under 72 chars
The skill asks about Co-Authored-By trailer and push in a single question
The commit uses a HEREDOC for proper formatting
git status is run after the commit to verify success

evals.expected_output: When there are no changes, the skill detects this and stops with a clear message instead of attempting to commit
expectations: The skill runs git status to check for changes
When no changes are detected, the skill informs the user with a clear message
The skill does NOT attempt to run formatters when there's nothing to commit
The skill does NOT attempt to stage files when there's nothing to commit
The skill stops early without asking about Co-Authored-By or push

evals.prompt: commit it, no co-author, and push
evals.expected_output: The skill creates a commit without the Co-Authored-By trailer and pushes to remote, respecting the user's inline preferences without asking redundant questions
expectations: The skill recognizes the user wants no Co-Authored-By trailer from the prompt
The skill recognizes the user wants to push from the prompt
The commit is created WITHOUT the Co-Authored-By trailer
After successful commit, the skill pushes without asking again
The skill uses git push -u origin <branch> if no upstream is set
